lead_paragraph: A double-width townhouse on the city’s East Side was Franklin D. Roosevelt’s residence for years, and his early administration took shape within.

headline.print_headline: That Other President-Elect’s Manhattan Transition Base
headline.main: Before That Gilded Tower, Another President-Elect Had a Manhattan Home Base

snippet: A double-width townhouse on the city’s East Side was Franklin D. Roosevelt’s residence for years, and his early administration took shape within....
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column offers tour of East 65th Street townhouse where Franklin Delano Roosevelt lived and ran his transition team in 1932 when he was elected president; building, which is now occupied by Hunter College's Roosevelt House Public Policy Institute, was where much of Roosevelt's New Deal policy took shape during transition.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Roosevelt House Public Policy Institute (Hunter College)
